info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 10:11AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood- prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 959 AM EDT, Heavy rainfall has ended across the Charlotte metro, but a very quick burst of 1-2" of rainfall fell in less than an hour, causing excessive runoff and rapid stream rises. Nuisance flooding is ongoing along Little Sugar Creek, primarily impacting the Little Sugar Greenway and especially near Medical Center Drive. Edwards Branch at Sheffield Dr is also out of its banks above Action Stage but it has already crested and will be falling back within bank momentarily. Rapid rises to near bankfull/Action Stage levels are also underway along Briar Creek. Significant rises are occurring along Irwin Creek as well, but it is expected to stay within its banks. Fortunately, smaller tributaries have crested and are already receding. Therefore, expect all streams to fall below bankfull levels within the next 60-90 minutes. - Light to moderate rainfall will persist for the next 30-60 minutes but no additional heavy rainfall is expected through the early afternoon hours. Up to an additional 0.25 inches is possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Pineville, Freedom Park, Southpark Mall, The Plaza, The Arboretum and Hidden Valley. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
